p:
Herpesviruses are
Large, enveloped viruses.
Contain double-stranded DNA.
150 nm in diameter.
DNA core surrounded by an icosadeltahedral capsid containing 162 capsomeres.
Capsid is enclosed by a glycoprotein-containing envelope.
Encode proteins that manipulate the host cell and immune response.
DNA replication and capsid assembly occurs in the nucleus.
Virus is released by
Exocytosis
Cell lysis
Through cell-to-cell bridges
Cause lytic, persistent, latent, and immortalizing infections
